Bought this ring for my husband as a surprise anniversary present using a sizing chart that I had downloaded to compare against his wedding ring (I couldn't remember exactly what size it was after seven years).  The ring was here within a week and it was packaged beautifully, but the ring didn't fit.  I thought I had received the wrong size.  So I mailed it back with the exchange form that was included in the box and within a day or two I received an email from West Coast Jewelry confirming the size I wanted.  After communicating with Frank through a few emails, we figured out that the sizing chart had been inaccurate and the ring was the size that I had ordered, so we went down a size.  The new ring arrived and fit wonderfully.  Not many companies would take the time to communicate and figure out what the problem was.  That's true service!
Thank you for the fast shipping and great condition of the ring. It was carefully packaged to ensure no damage which I really appreciate! My fiancee will definitely enjoy his wedding ring!

I'll keep these as a backup, but have ordered a pair of 180s for me too.

This is my absolute favorite dress! Love it! It fits like it was made for me, I wish all colors were available I'd order right now! It is extremely flattering to my mid section and all around petite but athletic frame. It is lower cut in the bust but in a flattering way. If the V-Neck cut is a concern when considering this dress I would say don't worry, it isn't inappropriate or distasteful but yes it is a V-neck and some women worry about that because some stores make the V's way too deep.  Even if you order this and think it is an issue they sell lace bandeaus to wear under or add a stitch or pin and that will solve it. I don't feel it is low at all and I wear a 36C.  They also have the wraps/shawls which I will be wearing to add a pop of color.  What I like most about this dress is the flattering nature of course but the rhinestone broach in the middle really makes it look much more expensive than it is. It dresses it up a lot! The bling detail is really pretty and dresses up an otherwise plain black dress. There is an extra piece of chiffon/polyester fabric overlay hanging from the broach on the waist too that is so elegant and flowy. The material is fine in my book plus it is nice and lightweight and keeps the cost down. I am 5'2"-5'3" and the length is NOT short it is perfect falling ever so slightly above my knees. I plan to wear 5" heels and it still looked appropriate. Maybe the reviewers that called it a mini were taller than me....(which is highly possible considering I am vertically challenged lol)....but even at that it isn't a mini by definition by any means. I couldn't be happier with a dress and this is my 4th dress by Ever Pretty and definitely the best. I also absolutely adore their customer service, this is a win-win in my books. Great products and great service! Only thing is I wish THIS dress came in more colors and I could get the blue one in my size! This dress fits like a glove ladies and I cant see it looking bad on ANY figure. Its disguising my weight gain from a medical issue and having little ones big time and makes me feel put together in a nice dress for a family wedding....cant beat that!
summary: MAGICAL DRESS! Like it was custom made for me!

A couple of the pairs in the sets I got weren't a very good match, but that's not very noticeable when they are on your ears, only when they're side by side in the box.  I would get these again as a gift for young girls, but I would opt for something of better quality for adults.

reviewText: I love every pair of earrings in this set. All I can say is Fabulous. My husband bought them for me and what a wonderful gift. What lady does not love getting 6 carats of gem stones!! The garnet is actually darker than what I have seen before, but in the sunlight, boy do they shine and show their color! I cant rave enough about these earrings. Just Amazing.

Pros: The  earrings have a nice color and shine to them. I have extremely sensitive ears that are easily infected even if I wear anything less than sterling silver for an hour. I have been wearing these for a couple of days now and my ears are not infected. Also the size is perfect for my ears.

Cons : the metal is extremely fragile.  You can actually bend the back without any effort. I would not recommend these for young children or anyone even slightly abrasive. Also, the metal is attached To the side instead of at the middle. Oh, and the blue topaz is very light. I am actually fine With the color but i expect some others might not be.
Overall, The price is great,  but I would prefer to pay more for a higher quality metal.
summary: Great price and color but super fragile.

That said, the applique and beading at the neckline are beautiful, and the outer fabric is exactly what I was looking for.

Ultimately, it requires some work, but will be well worth the $70 I paid for it.

This dress is a good one for this occasion. It looks very pretty, but not too simple. It loose a little bit in the chest, but I'll fix it. The delivery was very fast, two days if I not mistaken. Bowler Wool Felt Hat:
Size: Lg-XL; Color: Tan, with black band and brim edging.

I was very pleased that the hat I received looks identical in every way to the picture(s) provided here for this hat's listing. I love the shape, color, and thickness of the felt material. The crown measures about 5" tall. The brim is about 1 3/4" wide.

It holds its shape well the whole time I'm wearing it, though it is softer material than some bowlers.

I purchased the Lg-XL version. My head-hat size is 22 1/2" (57cm) and this hat in the Lg-XL version was about the right fit, only slightly looser than what I would consider a perfect fit. Foam strips were included that can be placed inside the inner band if the hat is very much too large. It was a close enough fit for me that I did not need to use the included foam strips. If the included foam sizing strips make the hat too tight, there are many different thinner materials that one can use to place inside the inner band to easily get this hat to fit well if it's too large. Keep in mind that this hat comes in a Medium-Large version too. This review I am doing is for the XL-Lg version only.

I am very satisfied with this purchase, considering the price, and recommend this product and seller.

reviewText: Works well as a helmet lock for a motorcycle.

My motorcycle does not have a factory helmet lock. This is the most convenient way to make sure my helmet doesn't fall off or walk away. It is not highly secure but at least it will deter casual theft. I can deploy it very quickly without much fuss.
Good for what it is made for .

Compared to the "precision works" lock that I bought, the cable on this is 2-3x thicker, which means someone with wire cutters is going to have a harder time (or no success) cutting through it to steal your stuff.

The combination wheels are separated from one another, so when you try to open the lock, you're less able to accidentally bump the wheel next to it.  I had a heck of a time trying to get all the wheels to keep from moving on the cheap  piece o'crap "precision works" lock.  Seriously, it shouldn't take 10 minutes to unlock your lock because you can't get the wheels to line up.
summary: Look at this lock before the other cheaper ones

reviewText: I love Kipling purses and I own several of them. I was unable to find the color, Vivid Purple, either locally or online, except from this vendor, so I assume it is no longer being made in the style I want. Although I probably buy 90% of my purses online, it's a hazard that you cannot visualize the size sometimes. I own another purse in the identical style (at least, I thought I did, looking at the picture) in turquoise. Love it! But this purse turned out to be easily half the size of the small one I own. I cannot even fit a normal-sized wallet in it. I had to buy a very small, square wallet to hold a single credit card and my keys for brief shopping trips. This bag is severely overpriced. If you don't mind the doll-like size or the price rip-off, buy it. It's still a Kipling and the quality is there. I suspect this bag was made for little girls who want to dress like Mommie.

Yes it does, the style is good too, however upon closer inspection it does look kindof cheap. The three small dials don't work seems like a sticker of something that gives the impression that those dials work. Also the extra two buttons on the side do NOT have any function. This watch in the picture looks nice but in reality it seems a bit cheap.

Also, when the package arrived, the watch did not have a box, instead it was in a plastic bag. It's not presentable specially if you want to give it as a gift.

My recommendation:
Keep looking for a better watch.
Spend a few more dollars for something better.

If the only thing you are looking for is a watch that tells time accurately, this is the watch for you.

What you see is very much what you get here.  This is the sort of necklace you would pick up at the mall.  Something Hot Topic might carry. This would be a really nice piece for a costume and is not bad just for wearing around. One of the best features is that you can hook it throughout the entire chain, so you can make it as short as you want.  Looks lovely with a simple dress.  It's a real centerpiece to any outfit.
My husband loves these boots. He bought them for work (he is a carpenter) but wears them everywhere, including hiking. He said they are so comfortable!

I bought this shirt as a dance practice top. I typically wear a medium. I bought this in large, and I can't run it through the dryer because it will shrink. It's just barely okay across the chest. It's not the best material - very cheap. If you look very closely in the picture, the way the light hits it, you can see what I mean. It sort of looks like velour, but it isn't. Also, it's not quite black. Because of the fabric, it's more of a weird dark gray. And it ends at the hips - which is okay, but it rides up - so instead of fitting smoothly along my torso, it just creeps up and bunches around my midsection, making me look like I've got rolls/muffins, etc. The back seems neat, but look closely in the picture. I realized the design is asymmetrical, but the weave of the design isn't quite "styled" in real life like it is here in the picture. I gave the top a shot and wore it... and immediately regretted it. Should have sent it back when I tried it on.
summary: Avoid, avoid, avoid. Cuter shirts out there than this.

I used 4 of these in my 7 years of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (grappling, with a lot of tight contact). I would never try another, if i could help it. These are very comfortable, they protect the partner by not scratching him with any plastic/rough parts, the exterior feels like a cotton rubber so you can use your "protected" head to put more pressure on your opponent and treat it like a 5'th limb.
Always buy two (so when you'll actually NEED to wear the replacement, you won't have to wait a few weeks to get it)

Don't wash-machine it after workout , i did that for the first two and then the straps became rough for my head as well as scratched the opponent, instead clean it with a fabric soaked in medicinal alcohol everytime you put your gi in the washing machine.

Cheers!
summary: Probably the best earguard ever-produced. Highly recommended

Nice design, Seiko. My wife picked it out.  Delivery quick.  Well packaged. But... Didn't run. Popped the case, and battery was dead. Must have been sitting on a shelf for five years or more.  Got a new battery and put it in.  Why would you ship a watch that wasn't working? How easy is that just look at the watch and make sure it works.  The bracelet was also too big. Took some good webbing on how to remove links. You would think Seiko would give a free hints in the instructions on bracket adjustment.  Clearly one size does not fit all.  I could have taken this to the jeweler and spent 10 bucks to replace the $ 2.99 battery and fifteen bucks to remove the links. I just paid for the new battery. Even so, the watch is nice. So, vendor bad. Amazon did their part well.

This is a lovely and tasteful watch. It is both fashion-forward and classic, and I am receiving many compliments on it! I find it comfortable and like the date on the dial. The rhinestones look like diamond chips instead of having a cheap "blingy" appearance. The case is stainless steel and water resistant, and there's a 14-year warranty on the watch. I am so happy with this purchase and recommend it to women in search of a classy, beautiful watch!

EDITED TO ADD: unfortunately, the watch band on this is bad quality. It's suede with sparkles, and after just six months of wear, the edges were peeling and separating. I replaced the band and now the watch is fine, but I've taken off two stars since the band ought to last longer than just a few months!

reviewText:
I LOVE this dress, it's gorgeous and it's very well made.  It's nice and heavy, but I love the fabric and the layers.  it's not clingy, which I love.  I first ordered this in a size large and it was quite big on me.  I thought I'd be able to order a medium and have it fit just right, but the difference in sizes in the two were quite a bit.  The medium was VERY snug on the shoulders and the large was very big around the waist.
I did decide to keep the large and use it with the belt, even though there is quite a bit of extra material there, my family said it didn't look gigantic on me.
For size purposes, I'm 5'6" and weigh 160 pounds.  I don't like to wear clothes that are clingy, so the large is great for me.
You will love this dress.

Super cute dress/coat!  The neckline is very pretty and the fabric is heavy enough to hold the structure.  However, the fabric is also too heavy to wear indoor (especially with the heat on during the winter).  The pull-over/slip-over style makes it very difficult to use as a coat.  Sadly, I had to return it.

This dress is really cute! Much better than I expected it to be. I'm 5'3" 130-135 lbs, 34DDD, and typically wear size 8 or mediums in clothing. I ordered the medium and it fits perfectly. When I first pulled it out of the bag I didn't think it would work for me and fully expected to have to return it. Without the belt, it fits like a tent and is not flattering. However once you belt it the magic happens and it becomes completely flattering! Usually I shy away from clothes that are shapeless until they are belted because I always end up looking like a sausage knotted in the middle. I buy dresses that already have a waist so this was an unusual purchase for me. But I'm so glad I bought it. I'm wearing it to a winter wedding and it's dressy but should keep me warm too. By the way, this dress is short. It comes at least 2-3 inches above my knees so this probably wouldn't work for someone really tall.

LOVE THIS! It is a thick material and extremely comfortable.  It is loose in all the right places and for lacking structure it hugs in all the right places so you don't look like a shapeless blob. Do yourself a favor and order this dress. No need to be scared of it being too small.  It is sized accurately.

So I bought this watch with the caveat that if it broke (or did not work) I would just go to the local mall and replace it with one of the $40.00 ones. Much to my delight, it is a beautiful watch, it runs well and keeps perfect time, and does not appear cheap at all. My daughter-in-law LOVES it and wears it every day and only takes it off to shower or clean house. This watch is a big hit with everyone and no one else around here has this model. I purchased one of these back in 2010 for my husband's engagement ring, and we've been happy with it ever since. The inlaid dragon pattern isn't (from what I can tell) made of the same material as the rest of the ring (which is apparent from the metal's slight discoloration after 5 years), and the pattern does cut off abruptly at one point, but I'm certain this is inevitible depending on the ring's size. I'm rather surprised by the amount of negative feedback this ring as has received, as it's proven to be very practical without losing its appeal; except needing a polish, the integrity of the ring is as good as it was new. Would purchase again if we needed to replace it for some reason.

Edit: It's worth noting that the photo's contrast is much stronger than the eye perceives naturally (this is especially true of the "black", which is in fact shadow and in person can look darker or lighter depending on the lighting). This may be why people are complaining about the color and detail (neither of which are lacking on the actual product).
summary: 5 years later, still happy I bought it.

reviewText: This is my son's 2nd pair of these Ray Bay Jr. eyeglasses and both were defective and did not last more than 6 months. Dealing with Luxottica Consumer Warranty and Repairs that handles Ray Ban's customer service is very difficult and extremely frustrating. I initially contacted them via email so I can include pictures(attached to this review) of the defective part along with my request for a replacement. It took a few back and forth emails before I realized it was pointless because I was only getting a computer generated generic response so I decided to call their toll free number. I provided the rep with the case / incident number as stated on the emails so she can understand what my concerns were and see the pictures for herself. I explained to her that I understood their policy for claiming warranty. However, given the fact that these were my son's prescription glasses and he had no spare to use while they conduct their warranty claim investigation that could take up to 6 weeks, I was hoping they will recognize the obvious defect of the part, simply send me the replacement and spare me the cost of sending them the glasses, take the risk of losing them in the mail or the lens sustaining damages that they stated they will not be responsible for and more importantly, my son not having the glasses he needs in order to see well! Instead, the rep reiterated the same generic response I got from the email giving me the option to either go through the entire warranty claim process or purchase the part to replace the factory defective one at a ridiculous price. I thanked the rep for her time and expressed my sentiments towards this particular Ray Ban product and their policy for warranty claims. My family and I all wear Ray Ban both as prescription glasses and sunglasses and have always been pleased with its quality with the exemption of this model. This was our very first contact with their customer service and it is unfortunate that the experience did not turn out the way I was expecting from a prestigious company such as Ray Ban whom I have been a big fan of for decades.

I purchased this wig through lightinthebox.com and as the other reviewers have mentioned the photo, at least the one on the site, was misleading. The blue is a darker very, very vibrate blue and the brown is more like black at least indoors. This is not a wig to be worn by someone who is a first time wig wearer unless you've got courage. I say this because people will stare and look at you. Despite this, I've gotten compliments on the color and people asking how I got my hair that way.

I have a large circumference head so the size was perfect for me and it's one of my favorite wigs despite how many I own. I do recommend you sew in clips on the ear tabs to make it stay more firmly in place though.

As the other reviewer mentioned, the color is different from the picture. Personally, I'm irritated, as the color is a dark, bright blue that looks extremely fake, as opposed to the more pastel tone in the picture, and the brown tone is more of a black. (More of a 131396 than a 6299D6 in HTML). I ordered this as a gift and planned to wrap it myself, so I haven't tried it on and can't attest to the cap size. Incredibly disappointed, and I'm not sure I can give it to a friend in good taste.

This wig looks lovely when you take it out of the package. The texture is very soft and pleasant and the colors are attractive. The blue is a bit darker and more vibrant than in the provided photos, but I do not mind the minor difference. The individual fibers are thin, so keep a wide-toothed comb with you to avoid tangling. The bangs are long so you will need to cut them to fit your face or style them swept to the side.

It's obvious that you're wearing a wig to anyone who gets close; this is not like other cheap-but-nice wigs I have purchased, which are often mistaken for my real hair. I doubt this was intended as a hair replacement anyway, given the price, but you could use it for that if you don't mind strangers knowing it's fake.

Unfortunately, the cap on the inside of the wig is VERY large, much bigger than on any other wig I have seen. If you use the adjuster straps to compensate, the cap's extra surface area bunches up into a bulge that sticks out far enough to be noticed by an onlooker. This is going to take some serious adjustment. I may even need to remove some of the hair and re-sew the cap entirely.

----  ----  ----

Pros: Soft, attractive colors, my boss likes it

Cons: Poorly sized, will not pass as real hair

----  ----  ----

Now I will sum up. *ahem* If you have a larger-than-average head, this wig is perfect for you. If your cranium is average-sized or small, don't waste your time.

reviewText: I really like these boots, they can be dressed up or down... only issue is if you step on the wedge heel wrong you may slip. I still really like them and wear them all the time.

I knew these boots would be cheap and fake leather and all, but I was not expecting such an overpowering stench. The smell of mostly likely cancerous chemicals is BEYOND overwhelming. I had to take these off after about an hour of work and put them in the furthest corner of my office. And my whole office still smelled like chemicals. The box these came in smelled like it was dipped in a vat of formaldehyde and nearly made me sick. I took it directly to the dumpster. I have cleaned the boots and rubbed baking soda on them and wrapped them in newspapers to absorb the smell, but it's still so overwhelming that it gives me headaches. Although I've gotten plenty of compliments the two times I wore the boots (great color), I just don't think it was worth even the measly $30ish bucks. Hopefully I've learned that it's worth it to just buy higher quality boots.

Silver lining? The shipping was quick and the product looks just like the photos.
summary: These boots smell like chemical death.

The product description says once size fits most.  This is absolutely NOT true.  I play roller derby and thought these would look totally boss.  I am about 5 foot tall, and just shy of 150lbs.  I did manage to get my legs to fit into the leggings, but the seams felt like they could burst at any moment and I was so restricted I would not have been able to move in them, let alone skate.  I gave them to a taller, slimmer skater who is very athletic and by no means overweight.  She also could not move in them; they were too tight.  So, I gave them to our smallest player, who is about my height and maybe weighs 90-100lbs.  She feels they are tight on her and may bust a seam soon, but she is able to wear and skate in them.  So, unless your legs are tiny little pencils like in the photo, these are not going to look good on you, let alone fit.
summary: One Size Does NOT Fit Most

reviewText:
ok so i never review products, ever.  but i always read them and base almost all my online purchases on them.  so it's completely unfair that i never write one, but there you have it.
however, this is the first time i have ever felt so compelled to write a review.  because we all know how horrible shopping for bathing suits are, and online is almost worse cuz you see something cute on a computer screen, read all about it, research reviews on like 4 different sites, hem and haw over whether you should take the chance, knowing full well that you will most likely be completely disappointed when the product arrives.  and i was super worried about this bathing suit.  see i had a baby 3 months ago and i'm just not quite ready for my old bikinis, and all my one pieces seemed out of style.  and frankly, i didn't feel so hot in those either.  but with a big family beach vacation coming up, i wanted something i could feel really good in.  and ladies i have to tell you, this suit did not disappoint!!
i tried it on as soon as it arrived and loved how i looked so much that i actually went outside to show my husband!  yep, right out the front door, actually wishing the neighbors would see cuz that's how good i felt.  the sexy retro look covers me exactly where i needed and exposes me exactly where i wanted...especially in the back, makes my butt look great! ;)  the padding in front makes me feel supported and fabulous. its even got this plastic sticky material like in a strapless bra to keep it in place.  and the sizing is spot on. i'm 5'6" 137lbs with a 38C bust at the moment, and normally wear a size 8.  the medium fits like a glove.  i was worried that the faux denim look would be cheesy or cheap looking, but its perfect.  like i feel like i should be riding a bike on a beach boardwalk in 1962 perfect.
i haven't worn it in the water yet, but i'm sure it'll be fine.  and let's be honest, most of us don't buy bathing suits for streamlined aquatic performance, we just want to look and feel sexy.  and this suit definitely did that for me.

I bought this suit to sport at our local gym, which has a busy pool area in the summer.  I wanted a modest yet cute and somewhat sexy suit, and this is perfection to the T.  It is slightly big in the chest and abdomen, but I'm small busted and recently lost a few pounds --- but it still is fine since the halter tie kind of allows for that adjustment.  I get multiple complements every time I wear it and it accentuates my shoulders beautifully!  I absolutely love it!

I looked and looked and finally settled on this swimsuit. It is not made for any woman that has any kind of top...if you know what I mean. It must be an A cup. I ended up giving it as a donation as it was just too much work to send it back. If you buy one of these suits be sure you know your size, because sending it back will not be easy.

The one slight drawback is that I may need to tie the halter straps pretty tight to keep it secure in the pool, and that doesn't feel great around the back of my neck.  I would think this suit may not provide great support for a larger bust.  Also, for reference, I weigh about 120 and am 5' 6", and the size small fits well. reviewText: This is my very favorite running bra -- I sure hope Moving Comfort keeps making this style.  The thing that makes this style so special is it provides excellent support without creating that uniboob look.  I also wear the Urban X-Over playing golf for the moisture wicking and I feel great in it.

It's also very comfortable! Great on those 5+ mile runs and bike rides, gonna trust it when running a 50K next month. Not sure how it does with regular gym workouts as it was use by a runner.
summary: Controls the girls while in motion. Long distance Runner approved!

reviewText:
I just have to start by saying that I am a full 34D at most stores.  I'm young-ish (28...oh gosh, that means I'm almost 30), petite, and very active.  This means that I need a sports bra that actually keeps the girls in place when running, standing on my head in yoga, climbing rocks, etc., doesn't pinch in weird places, is the perfect blend of modest and sexy (i.e. I don't desire full cleavage when working out, but I don't want a bra that goes to my clavicle either), and holds up well.  Moreover, I loathe the uni-boob that cheap elastic bras give.

According to the size chart provided on the moving comfort website, I should have ordered a small C/D.  I was skeptical but I trusted in the website...  So, I did; I ordered that size.  Unfortunately, it was MUCH too small.  After a little unorthodox yoga I did manage to get it on and fastened in the back.  It was too tight around and the cups barely covered the gals (I realize I'm busty for my size but a C/D should mean a C/D!).  So, when ordering this model ladies, size up!

The good stuff:  This is a well made over-the-shoulder-bolder-holder.  No loose stitching, the elastic seems to be high quality.  I like that you can adjust the straps and the width around.  Moreover- the color (I got the red) was beautiful!  I will be returning this order and replacing it with a larger size.  I'll update this review after my girls have done their damage on this brassiere to report how well it wears long-term.
summary: Good quality, but the girls are squished!

I wanted to like this as I thought it was beautiful in the photo. I was expecting a delicate, silken, twisted, silver cord with a nice silver pendant. What I got was thick, beefy drapery cord-like rope with two large silver balls on the end with some chunky chain hooking it to a large locket. The cording is multi-strand twist of black cords with silver colored cotton thread wound tightly around the cores. Which is fine, but it produces a dull finish rather than the silken look in the photo; and if the threads are snagged or out of place there is a black 'mark' in the design. It is more tacky than elegant.

I am assuming the market for this type of necklace is for it to be locked on and not come off, i.e. BDSM Collars, loving locket to a wife, etc. But I was concerned that the cording would not dry out completely from showering, etc and perhaps mildew or rot.

The locket is however stunning! It is worth the price of the whole necklace. It is shiny, about the size of a half dollar, and really works! I slipped the lock onto a sterling silver "Omega" choker necklace. I took the regular clasp off that necklace and replaced with a few jump rings I soldier closed and my Sir locked it around my neck. It now looks like something I can wear anywhere and only those 'in the know' would know what it really stands for, all others think it is a beautiful piece of jewlery.
summary: This has potential with some buyer modifications

-- Shipping time & cost was satisfactory.
-- Stones were of advertised size -- small -- which I needed for a specific project.

-- MASSIVE PROBLEM:  Stones are not genuine RUBIES!  They are fakes that are dyed to look like rubies.  I used only 2 stones on a necklace that I wear frequently and within about a month, the vibrant color has completely faded and worn away.  Genuine Rubies do not do this.

-- Suggestions for Future Buyers:  If you want the real thing, spend the extra money to get the real thing.  If you don't mind the fake aspect and just want something that RESEMBLES a ruby, then this will work but don't use on something that will get frequent use as the color will fade and the whole point of getting something that resembles a ruby is null and void.

This pendant sure gets a lot of attention.  The pictures don't do it justice.  The spinner ball in the center is made up of gemstone shaped metal pieces that shine almost as brightly as the crystals around the outside.  I'm personally customizing this pendant by taking the crystals out, and replacing them with fire colored crystals from the craft store, to make the symbol even more eye-catching.  The white crystals are nice and subtle as they are, though.  This is the gaudiest necklace I've ever owned that still manages to look incredibly masculine.  Looks good with active men's clothing, fashionable neutrals, gothic/emo styles, anything that is a step above the other guys plain brown hoodie.  Worn with very plain clothes looks very dumb.  Dress nicely, and this little guy will steal the stage with you.  People are always playing with my spinner ball.  XD

reviewText: I wore this shoe for at least 20 yrs with about four pairs to bicycle and work in our yard.  This shoe in a size 11 medium, which I just purchased, fits like a glove.  The quality for me is as good as ever.  My foot is a little on the narrow side of medium so if your foot is on the wide side, I think it would be snug.  My old shoes were always black with a black sole.  I do not object to the natural latex color of the soles, in fact I like it but it would be a good idea to offer both colors, but don't drop black leather uppers. BUT, The leather in the old shoe was softer and there was more room in the toe box.  I think I would still prefer the black sole over the natural latex color.  As Ive found out, good old friends from the past change as well as good old shoes from the past!  Why can't the shoe companys leave a good popular, useful, well fitting, comfortable, long lasting shoe alone?  They all do this.  This is my updated take after several weeks.  Upon closer examination the width on both pairs of these shoes I purchased are unmarked and also the box is unmarked, but I ordered 11D in both pairs. So the problems with this shoe are; too narrow, narrow toe box,no arch support,stiff leather,black shoe should have black sole.  If these dislikes were corrected this shoe would sell like gangbusters. The soles on these shoes are very slippery on wet surfaces.  The old shoes were not like that!
summary: We all wish for the old shoe.

reviewText: The watch itself is great. It was exactly what I was looking for but the band is horrible. Maybe I received a defective one but the pins that attach the clasp to the band popped out literally out of the box. I glued it back in and the next day another pin popped out. I may keep the watch if I can find an decent band to fit it otherwise its going into the trash.

The fit, finish, look, and feel all belie what I spent for this timepiece. Is it perfect? No. But I have seen watches costing well over 10 times what I paid for this, that were of similar or even an inferior quality. It is well worth the investment.

The LED digital functions include 12/24 hour time, month, day, year, day of the week, and an alarm. The digital functions are only visible for a few seconds when activated; otherwise only the analog function is visible. The digital display is easily visible in both dark & brightly lit conditions. There is no lap, countdown, or other timing functions, so if that is of concern, then this timepiece is not for you. But, if you want simple time, date, day, and alarm functionality, this watch delivers them supremely.

Note: Do not be confused by the individuals who complained about the band being too long. They obviously have no background in engineering. Simply locate the round pin that joins each link and using a small punch, drive it out. Two pins must be removed to in order to take out one link; save one of the two pins to rejoin the band where the one (or more) links were removed. I took one link out on either side of the clasp (a total of two links) to keep the clasp centered. There is additional adjustment with spring loaded pins in the clasp for a PERFECT fit!!!

I am extremely pleased with my purchase and recommend it highly to anyone interested in a substantial, fashionable, and solid timepiece.

It does run small, and I think I should possibly have gone up two sizes instead of one.  I didn't notice the different categories in the size chart, so it is a little snug but still do-able.  The color is vibrant and rich, and the material has a very nice drape.  I would recommend this dress very highly - just make sure to double check on the size chart for the appropriate category.  The price is also very reasonable for my purposes.  All in all, I have completely happy with my purchase.
summary: Makes for a lovely Mother of the Bride dress.

reviewText: way too much material

I was looking for a dress to wear to my son's wedding.  I found this dress to be flowy and elegant and it was just what I expected.  I consulted the size chart and found it to be helpful.  The dress was a perfect fit.  Beware that it says this is a JUNIOR dress.  I am an adult and used the measurements chart instead of my usual size.  I wear medium usually in adult sizes and bought the XL.  Perfect.  I am small/medium  but large-busted and there was more than enough room in the bust.  The mesh overlay is chiffon-like, soft, and elegant.  It shows a bit of cleavage but there is enough room for me to add a snap or hook to close it up a bit.  The rhinestone pin is removable and adds a nice touch of sparkle.  There are pads in the bust area for coverage.  I doesn't say it in the description, but mine came with a matching scarf-a nice surprise.  I feel a bit of stretch in the fabric too so that's an added benefit.  It shipped in 3 days.  LOVE IT!!!
Very satisfied with the dress.

I will probably make a modesty panel for the neckline from the scarf provided - a Grandmother of the Bride I am not comfortable with that much exposed in front. Otherwise I really like the style & fabric & am pleased I found it.

I did not receive any instructions, perhaps they were just left out. I use punches all the time so I know how to handle them, a beginner may not.

Also, the blue container lasted for 4 open and closings before it split at the seams on two sides, Just be careful when you grab your punches and I suggest putting them in a different container.

On the positive side, I really like like the punches, they work very well and have given me clear letters and number stamps each time used.

reviewText: I bought this watch because I wanted a nice watch for work and wanted the function of an alarm.  Throughout the day I could have a task that needs to be done. This is an excellent show.  I bought my first pair in San Antonio after bringing foolishly uncomfortable shoes to a conference. I bought my second pair 3 years later after the first pair wore out.  I was hesitant to purchase these because of the pattern and worried about what I would wear them with, but I am so happy I did.  These shoes go with almost everything and I get compliments every time I wear them.  They are stylish, comfy, and classy which I love!  And I will confess....I stalked them on Amazon until my size was in stock and then purchased them ASAP.  Would have bought 2 pairs if they were available.  I did buy a pair in plain black too.

The fabric is extremely durable and when I disposed of the first pair it was only because of the soles.  I walk heavy on my heels and I was surprised that the shoes lasted 3 years (worn in spring, summer, and fall) with the amount of walking I do at work (roughly 3 miles a day - outside and inside).  The front of the soles were fine.  The fabric looks almost brand new, no holes or tears, the patent leather fronts looked good.  One of my favorite things is that the shoe didn't get wider with wear.  I have narrow to normal feet in terms of width, but I have noticed that a lot of flats will get wide in the center after several months of wear.  These don't. YAY!

Comfort - these shoes are comfy for wearing all day.  I hate flats that dig into my heels and these don't, which was a welcome surprise.  I also enjoy that they have a sole and heel, so it doesn't feel like I am walking on the ground.  I hate that about the ever so popular ballerina flats.  I have very high arches and these don't have support.  I haven't add anything to them to create support, but I am not at a place where I worry about that too much.

TIP: Pick up your feet - I tend to drag the front of my foot when I walk and I caught the curb once with the toe.  The patent leather will dent (what patent leather doesn't) and scratch, so be careful.  It wasn't anything horrible and a little heat from the blow dryer helped smooth it out.  If they don't look shiny anymore try Windex.

Bought the ring under a year ago.  Wore the ring for 10 months.  Never wore in ocean or pool.  Took off to go fishing and play golf or work out.  Biggest piece of crap I have ever bought.  Braiding came apart and it had multiple hairline fractures in the rope.  took to a master jeweler and had him look at it.  Ring did not fall apart from abuse, but from a manufacturers default.  Which this seller will not back. So now I am out over $700.

Don't waste your money on this crap.  Will never recommend this vendor.
summary: Don't Waste your money---copmany does not stand behind jewelry

I've had Funtasma shoes before, and they last a reasonably long time. You absolutely cannot beat this price on any other website.

I hate wearing heels.  I belong to the camp of people who would rather be comfortable than fashionable. But I bought these shoes for pole dancing classes, and they are great for that purpose. I can say that they are comfortable for the hour that I wear them dancing, and I once wore them for 3 hours and was not bothered.
They are a little tighter than normal shoes, but the material will stretch out with time, so it is better to get them a little bit small as opposed to a little bit big.  I normally wear size 9.5-10, but I bought these in a size 9.  They were a little bit difficult to get on the first couple of times, but I am happy I went with the smaller size now that I have had these for about 6 months.

This is bad because if you're doing a poopy diaper, and you miss a spot, or you need your lifting hand to help you wiping hand get another wipe you're gonna have a skid mark on your vera b. So what I do is have these water proof changing pads and I just fold it up and put it in the pocket. There are two pockets. I'm not sure which pocket is for what. One pocket is like a normal pocket, with a side facing opening and no securing amenity, so basically stuff can fall out like whoa, hasn't happened to me yet but I'm sure it will. The other pocket is a mesh one, the opening is like lips. I put my diapers in there but I think its for wipes. I think that the changing pad its self is too long. My baby is only two months old, so I'm sure I'll be happy its long when she's 2 and I'm still changing her diapers.

reviewText: Ordered this shirt for a big rave. Worked the whole night through. Was a great purchase. If you are thinking about getting a sound activated shirt emazing lights has the best quality.

I bought this as part of my halloween costume. One thing that should be noted. This is an EL panel. It is a visibly obvious panel in well lighting. The image makes it looks like the edges can't be seen. but you'll be able to tell its something attached to a shirt in decent lighting. However I knew it would be like that. I didn't actually use the shirt, I just took the panel off and attached it to the back of another shirt. The shirt itself has an inner sleeve for the wiring to run through as well as a pocket to hold the inverter. The inverter makes an audible tone when its activated, but considering that its sound activated, its nigh impossible to notice it over the sound that activated it, save for tapping on it. This tone is necessary for the EL panels to glow at their brightest, so don't bother trying to find one without it. It'll be disappointingly dim. the light is visible in moderate indoor lighting. But not strong. in sunlight its unnoticed. In poor lighting ( like a club) its as bright as the sun. There is no variation in the levels of the equalizers. the bars raise the same way every time, but they do it a natural way. You would only notice its not right if you're a serious sound junkie, or if you just stared at it for 30 seconds. The panel is held on with velco(hooks and loops) and can be removed for cleaning. It has a sound sensitivity slider, which is pretty good. But if you're in an environment with overwhelming noise. like a concert, it'll pretty much be always on with the lowest setting. But in moderate sound like a bar, or party you'll have no trouble adjusting it to respond to desire.

This shirt with a sound activated illuminating panel is so good. The lights flashes colors with the music and sound. The material is so soft. Its fits me perfect. Batteries can be remove for washing. I love everything about this shirt and happy to have it.

The fabric itself is like a knit sweater and it's a very warm material. The only thing that really disappointed me was the color - as the dress I received was a much darker teal blue than the dress pictured on Amazon which is more of a cobalt blue.

While this may sound like a negative review, I do actually like this dress and once I've fixed it up a bit I know I'll be wearing it out - especially come fall and winter.
summary: Nice dress, but may require adjustments to fit your tastes.

reviewText:
This was one of the best jewelry purchases I ever made. This is such a durable ring! I've had it for 5 months, & besides some little scratches it is exactly as good as when I got it! I have barely taken it off & it hasn't tarnished, turned colours, or anything. Definitely genuine sterling silver. I can't rave enough about the quality!
The design is exactly how it looks & it's WONDERFUL! I first got this ring when I saw it worn by Maisie Williams from Game of Thrones :)

Anyway, the durability. quality, and cuteness of this ring make it well worth the $25 I spent for it!
Works well on light colored ostrich-hide boots, doesn't make them darker.

This is what I use on all my finest leathers.  My gloves, my calf leather, my soft leather half-vest.  Everything malleable and buttery.  Nothing else works quite like it.  Other treatments leave them feeling waxy, oily, or sticky.  This leaves them feeling perfectly cared for, and lasts quite a long time.  It results in a mellow, almost matte finish in my experience.  Very nice to the touch.  If you're looking for something to use on a fine soft leather flogger, this is it.  It also has much less odor than anything else I've used.

I sometimes apply it over their black creme {NOT polish} when i need to re-tint.  I've found it takes the edge of those higher wax products.

It's expensive, but so is any leather that deserves it.  The middling stuff you can just use leather honey,  This is for the stuff you really love.
summary: This is for the stuff you love.

I love the colors on this purse. The cow hair adds a neat dimension to it as does the embossed turquoise leather at the bottom. This is bigger than I thought it would be, but that was more of my issue. It is true to the advertised dimensions, I was just too lazy to pull out a ruler. There are a bunch of pockets to tuck everything into. The entire main part of the purse zips shut. I wasn't sure if it would or not based on the description, but it does. When you open the main zippered compartment there is a center zipped pocket inside with a large open area on either side of it. It really helps to organize everything. There was also a genuine leather tag in the purse when it arrived. Also, each metal buckle, zip pull, etc was wrapped in tissue paper so it wouldn't be scratched. I was impressed by that. I would definitely recommend this purse if you are looking for a good sized purse.

reviewText: Fantastic product. Great quality...my nephew loved it!

I can't begin to say how good this thing looks.  From two feet away you'd swear it was hammered out of iron and bronze.  The plastic it's molded from is about 2mm thick, it's sturdy enough to take a bash from a toy sword.  Some of the inside edges are a tiny bit on the sharp side, I may have to smooth them down if the kids find it uncomfortable, but in general the finish is very good all the way around the helmet.  No gaps in the metallic finish, and the details, carving in the "bronze" ring, rivet heads, etc, are fantastic.
I would not hesitate to use this as stage costuming for a serious theater production, it looks that good.  I think the biggest problem I'm going to have with it, to be honest, is getting the rest of my boy's Halloween costume to look good enough to go with it.  :-)
summary: Looks great, and tough enough for play

reviewText:
The wader quality is good. The boots are too bulky. My boy is 5, almost 6yrs old. The 1000gr boots are too heavy for him to lug around. Not sure why they don't offer a 400 or 600 gram boot. Also, he wore them yesterday first time for duck hunt. He complained a lot they were hurting him. I couldn't tell where. At lunch we too them off and the sides of both legs were rubbed raw, I felt bad for not taking him serious earlier that morning. The area rubbed was directly below the knes on inside and outside both calves/shin. The problem is the top of the boot is so narrow shaped it digs into the skin when walking.
 Not sure if they can be "trained" with a clamp and heat, then cool again. But for $159 at Mack's, I should have to reshape the boot so that it doesn't dig into the side of leg. I've had the same problem with Gamewinner waders and Duck Commander waders.

We're now looking into the "Oakiwear" waders, but they are out of his size, I'd settle for size 13 or 1 so he could grow into them next year. Finding good youth waders is not an easy task. And since we live in Louisiana, 1000gram is just way too bulky and not necessary. 3 star because it really is good quality, other than the top of boot is shaped narrow. It looses 2 stars because they don't offer a lighter boot and rubbed my boys legs raw.

Maybe the boot cuffs are narrow from being laid flat in the box for so long.
summary: The wader quality is good. The boots are too bulky

This is a nice shirt for the money and would be an excellent addition for those of you who work in an office, business casual environment. It has a mature, professional look to it. Therefore, any man from their 20s through their 50s would look  just fine in it. The slit at the top is not cut deep, and it doesn't reveal any more of the chest than if you left the top button open of a more traditional polo shirt. Warning, this is a slim/athletic cut style. If you don't have a six pack, you will feel some tightness across the stomach and underarm areas. If you do not normally order your clothes in the slim/athletic category, I strongly encourage you to go up one size, two sizes if you're of average size. As I mentioned, earlier, this is a mature looking shirt, so you are not required to have a flat stomach (which I don't) to look good in it.

I also found that wearing them without socks is the best way to wear these otherwise I found your foot tends to slide around and not grip the inside of the shoe when wearing socks.
Yes, you will have a little flapping noise when you walk around, nothing too loud, very similar to wearing flip-flops.  As far as size, I noticed they run just a bit large; long in length and a touch wide.  I ordered a size 10 when I normally wear a 9 or better yet a 9.5.  The size 10 gives me about 1/2" from the back of my heel to the back of the shoe.
summary: My first mule and I love them.

reviewText: Just what I was expecting from HH. This thing is a tank ready for lifetime of abuse. The hollow grind makes it sharper than you would think for a knife this thick, but it's still not a razor by any means. If you're looking for a precision cutting tool, this isn't for you. This is a workhorse meant for some heavy use.

This is a fantastic knife, I may be biased because I am Australian but I also own a lot of knives made in America and have used them extensively so I know a little about knives. Every person who I know that owns one of these knives loves it, its tough and holds its edge and will take anything you can through at it. I have used this knife to cut firewood, finish of pigs or my US brothers call them hogs, cut rope and a myriad of other things. I have often thought that this is a Ka-bar on steroids and a new generation fighting/field knife. One last thing, this is made in Australia which is on par with America and nothing soft comes out of the land down under.

Check out the link below from Aussie reviews if you want a proper review of this knife

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L2RkKOSg0FI

The areas left wanting are the handle and the sheath.  My hands are medium size, but I find the handle a little short. More contouring to better fit the hand would be helpful also.  The sheath is well constructed, but the main downer is the use of velcro, instead of snaps, for closures on the retaining straps.  The quality, and fit/finish of the knife are excellent.  The blade shape, stout design, and reasonable heft are all things I really like about the knife.  While the issues stated above keep a great quality knife from an overall excellent knife, they are not deal breakers, and I'm still very happy with the knife.

I liked the effect but wanted to let purchasers know to adjust washing technique or use additives for color bleeding. Hang to dry. I received ALOT of compliments from males and females on this jacket; a rare occurrence for me. Ordering another color for me with Xmas money is a strong option for me.

Perfect for 12 year old skinny tall boy

My son is 5' tall, 12 years old, and built like a stick figure!  He has a 25" waist and the 26"W x 32"L were perfect!  They are stylish and not tight skinny jeans, just built for a skinny kid!  Most of the other jeans that I can find in this size are either baggy and look like they don't fit (even though the waist and length are good) or they are "vintage" and have that awkward high waist that is just plain uncomfortable and dorky looking.  These are the best for his build, followed closely by the Levi 514's that I could only find one pair of in his size.  You can find more options by searching for "Student Jeans" if you are looking for smaller waist and longer inseam, but you really need to look no further than these for tall and skinny kids!  When did Dickies get hip?! Yeah!!

reviewText:
These jeans are extremely soft and comfortable. I like that they are slim-fitting while still having enough stretch to not feel constricting. The color is also very accurate to the pictures.

Then, there's the sizing. As many other reviewers have noted, these jeans run small. For perspective, I am 5'5" and weigh 120 lbs. I am consistently a size 3/size 26 in all of my pants. I heeded the advice of the other reviewers and ordered a size 5. It fit like a size zero. I returned it and ordered a size 7. It fit like a size 1. I returned them again and ordered a size 9. The 9 fit perfectly. Although it was a pain returning and re-ordering multiple times, I am very happy to have found the size that fits me. Just be aware that you'll likely need to go well more than one size up (I went three sizes up).

reviewText:
Fantastic watch.  Bit more interesting than a normal quartz watch, as this has a mecha quartz movement.  The chrono's second hand sweeps and springs back like a true mechanical, and the chrono's pushers make a really satisfying click when used.  I was a bit worried about the watch looking too toy like with the blue accents and second hand, however the effect in person is pretty understated.  Its a great looking watch that also performs well.

Only complaint is that the bracelet feels a bit cheap; would advise that you also pick up a nice leather strap, as it really ups the quality of the watch (and looks great, just scroll through a couple pictures people have posted here with a brown leather strap).
summary: Fantastic watch. Bit more interesting than a normal quartz ...

reviewText:
It's rare that a new watch, especially one at this price point truly amazes. Pictures do not do this one justice, a really good looking watch. The shine, the lume, the color combinations; aesthetically it has hit all the right spots. The lume is laid out well, standard Seiko fare with regards to longevity and intensity. The case is a near perfect size on my 6.5ish inch wrist. A clean looking tool watch that could pass for dress when paired with a suit or sport coat.

Functionally it has a very reliable meca-quartz movement that lives up to Seiko's reputation. Having the chronograph operate as one would expect an automatic chronograph to operate is an added bonus. Sub-second measurements, smooth tick and a lighting fast reset.

It's rare Seiko disappoints, but they have delivered well above and beyond all expectations with this one; especially at this price point.
summary: Good looks, reliable function, incredible value.

reviewText: Love the look and feel of this watch. Well made. The biggest downside with this watch and others that only offer 1 or 2 adjustment holes, is that getting the perfect fit can prove impossible if your wrist falls in between. Given that wrist size can very in climate and the usual wrist size changes that can occur, all watch bracelets should offer at least 5 adjustment holes in the clasp to allow for proper sizing and adjustment. Just my opinion and observation from this and other watches that do not give you the proper adjustment range when sizing.
summary: Love the look and feel of this watch

I wanted a slouchy beanie, and this definitely fit the bill. It is just warm enough to keep your head and ears from freezing in the cold, but I can tell it will still be wearable in the warmer months as well which is great. It isn't quite as bright a purple as pictured, but I think the color I received is much prettier than the almost neon-purple in the picture. The slouch is great, doesn't poof awkwardly on top, and holds my chest-length curly hair securely. Feels very high quality and like it won't disintegrate in the washer. The band used to hold it in place is also great, just small enough to keep everything where it should be but not too tight that it's uncomfortable. It is versatile as well, you can roll up the ends a bit to turn it into a fitted beanie or a beret depending on how you feel like wearing it. Shipping time was great and there was a cardboard insert to make sure it kept its shape during shipping. Would not hesitate to buy another.

reviewText: Have been using these for about a week and they do the trick of keeping my ears warm while I listen.  I've never used behind-the-head earmuffs so they take some getting used to. Plus, they have a self-tightening spring inside that's meant to keep them in place, but begins to hurt my ears after a while.  They are quite warm and sound is quite good - better than earbuds and more comfortable.  All in all, I'm pleased with these.

The headphone portion of the earmuffs works as expected-they are a little quiet compared to some other headphones I have, but they are still plenty loud enough. The 1/8th" cord is detachable, and is actually just an 1/8th extender, so one end male, one end female-you could easily utilize your own cord if for whatever reason you did not want the built-in mic. I have not put the mic through its paces as I have no use for it, so I cannot comment on its quality, etc.

The earmuffs fit as expected, and they are warm. They do exert a bit more pressure than others of their kind(due to the headphones, I'd guess), so they are a bit more uncomfortable to wear with glasses than others. If you're particularly sensitive or will be wearing these for extended periods of time with glasses, you might want to reconsider.

The cord is very long, and is more than adequate for connecting my phone to the earmuffs. I haven't measured it, but I'm 5'11", and with my phone in my pocket there's still a good 6-7" of cord left just dangling.

At first, I thought I may have been given the wrong headphones, as the instructions that came with them said the connection to the headphones was removable and was located on the left side. The pair I received had the connection on the right side(and amazon's picture indicates this is correct). The cord is removable, but it took me a bit to figure out how. The connection is covered by a small swath of earmuff cloth, so you can't just tug on the cord and pop it loose. It is reasonably difficult to re-connect and disconnect the headphones, but I prefer it this way as it means they won't come loose while wearing.

I wanted baggy but not swimming in them. Perhaps they would be if I got XXL but then the waist would be really big so I chanced the Large.
Hope that helps anyone trying to figure out if they should get these.

I wear a 4/5 typically and I ordered a Size 6 which is a Large and these fit perfectly!  They are very cute, stylish and still have a feminine look!  They are a tiny bit tighter in the backside and a little looser in the waist, but I think that's just my body type and not a flaw in the pants.  They are lightweight and it's hard to see online, but they have gold zipper pockets which I think are cute.  I stressed and stressed over the sizing on these because of the negative reviews so I hope this helps someone!  I recommend ordering these from Amazon (as the distributor), apparently it is very difficult to return these if you get them directly from the seller (in China I believe).  These pants came in less than a week and they were VERY well wrapped LOL!
summary: If you need help with sizing....because I sure did...

reviewText:
I ordered the Keep Calm and Dance on Shirt from Ann Arbor T Shirt company. I love the shirt! The saying is cute and also the little ballerina. I saw the order online and knew I wanted it. The color of the shirt is red and matches the picture online exactly. The decal also matches exactly, so no surprises! I don't know how to describe the decal material, but it is secure on the shirt. Sometimes printed shirt can have cheap decals- like the ones you get on the boardwalk at the beach that peel off; but this decal does not look like it is going to come off in the wash. The tee shirt is made out of 100 % cotton, so it is soft and durable but still very comfortable. The size of the shirt is what I expected as well. I ordered it larger than my usual size because I plan on wearing it as a pajama top or to lounge around in, but I was not disappointed by the size whatsoever. The shipping on the package was exceptional as well. The shirt arrived two days after I placed the order. I love the shirt and believe it is better than compared items that are similar. I will be looking to order from this company again in the future.

Disclaimer - I did receive this product at a discounted price or free in exchange for an unbiased and honest review. I take my reviews serious and will only provide accurate and honest feedback. I am not connected to this company or any of the companies of products that I review.

My daughter desperately wants me to be a fox with her for Halloween, so I went looking for a dress similar to what she has. I won't go into how this is barely qualifying as a fox costume, because you can see that for yourself, but I'll let you know about fit and quality.

First of all, it's short. If I use the clear straps, it's TOO short. But if I pin it to my corset bra (Which won't slip under a little weight,) it's just fine length-wise. (Assuming you don't mind a little cleavage.)

I'm a US size 4/5 in pants and dresses with a C cup bust, and the width on the s/m size was fine with a little room to spare, but not TONS of room.  The length, again, was fine if I wasn't using the clear straps.

The quality was what you'd expect from a Halloween costume. Decent, but not amazing. Nothing tore when I put in on or took it off, the tail slid onto the hook and was a little shorter than I'd like, but respectable. The fur on the hood is a mess, but I'd expect that from being packaged. (There's no saving it, though, sorry.)

The corset strings really don't let you tighten it up at all, so if you want a snug fit you'll need to be handy with a needle.

Overall I'm satisfied, though to be honest I'd never have chosen it without my daughter being hooked on this idea.

Loved this costume, unfortunatly the quality of workmanship is not good with every item of the costume. I ordered two XL dresses. I am a 10/12 with long arms and broad shoulders more of straight athletic build I guesse. The first costume arrived with a large jacket and an XL dress with a broken zipper and missing neck tie. The jacket is beautiful, truly. Vivid red strech velvel and nice gold embroidery and piping with lots of nice detail. I wish I could have made the large jacket work as it was constructed better than the second one.  I will mention that the XL dress is more like a size 14/16 and short! Thankfully the tails of the coat are long enough to cover the back or it might result in a wardrobe malfuntion possibly.

The second costume arrived, the jacket would have fit me but it fell apart as soon as I tried it on. I was careful but still multiple buttons fell off, the chains on the front of the coat were barly sewn on and came apart immediatly, and the back applette came off as well. The dress was intact and I could have pinned it to work if I had the inclination.

 A few other notes, the hat is comically flat and floppy on arrival, however you could make it work by spritzing it with a little water and stuffing it full of paper to pull out the creases and hold its shape while wearing it, a trick I learned from another costume. Jacket could have been repaired to work with safty pins in a hurry, or an hour or restiching if your are determined. For some this might be worth it because the costume in person is lovely, but I opted to look for another option with better workmanship for all of the purchased pieces since I had the time.

Adds a bit of weight around your waist, but on the plus side it feels like it will stay put and not move like some belts do. It's one-size fits all, too - there's enough adjustment room to easily fit all common waist measurements. I absolutely LOVE this belt, and I'll be getting a Tardis one soon, too.

-----------PLEASE READ-----------
There is a reason why this shirt is relatively cheap, and the reason is this: the shirt is poorly tailored. Imagine you are given a sheet of fabric and told to actually make a shirt (having no shirt-making experience whatsoever). You naively make two tubes for the arms and a big one for the torso and then stitch them together. THAT'S WHAT THIS SHIRT IS LIKE. There is extra fabric where there shouldn't be, poorly put together, and it just looks a mess. By the way, tucking it in will not help your case either.

But hey, maybe I got the 1-out-of-1000000 shirts that come out bad. However, I felt compelled to post my review for this shirt should this not be the case.
summary: Poorly tailored. Invest in other shirt.

I will never buy anything else with CCEnterprises ever again unless you change your name and get me fooled unknowingly. When a customer orders an item with a 3-5 days normal delivery speed, they expect to receive the item in that time; they do not want to be given a bogus tracking number from which they cannot retrieve any information; they do not want to wait after the last estimated delivery day to write an inquiry and find out days later that the item wasn't shipped yet and that they have to wait another week or so to receive the product...weeks after it was supposed to get here already! people buy stuffs prompted by a specific need and receiving them extremely late is a betrayal of trust, a scam no matter what excuses you may have, I don't take any excuses! you take my money, you deliver! By the way, the pair of sunglasses I received is of bad quality and useless, one of the nose pad is pointing towards my eye because the pad arm is crooked...it doesn't seem to have been inspected before packaging in transparent plastic bag and shipping...I'll just put it in the trash and move on so that I can spare myself the predicament and huge emotional distress of dealing with you! You don't deserve even one star!!!

Sorry, I digress. Anyway, so when I was released and finally got to see my baby girl, I was so happy to be able to dress her up in this cute little onesie! It reminded me of my time inside, the beatings, CO abuse, etc. That said, I'm only giving it one star, because I think it's made with Chinese prison labor which I hear is paid less than U.S. prison labor. reviewText: Summer's here. You want to wear shorts without having your ugly white socks peeking up and saying "look how pedestrian I am" to every passerby. What's the solution? Some nice, quality "no-show" socks, of course. Sadly, you're going to hate wearing these socks... Pros: - Fit my size 12 feet just fine. - They are truly "no-show" unlike those lying "low-cut" socks. Cons: - The material is thin and does nothing to absorb sweat. Sweaty feet are not sexy. - The seams are thick and rub as you walk giving you either calluses or blisters. - The socks have little to no friction which means your feet slip around in the shoes constantly. - The toes wear out after one or two uses leading you to burn through an entire pack within a week (yes, I keep my nails well cut and filed). With all that said, I cannot recommend these. So, what do I recommend? At the moment, the best bang for the buck would be the SHEEC - SoleHugger ACTIVE Men's No-Show Casual Socks. Save yourself some time, money, and aggravation and get those, not these.
summary: Avoid. There's Much Better Products Out There.

I've purchased these almost a dozen times over, because eventually the screws at the joints fall out, and are often too small to find on the ground. I've continued to buy them repeatedly because they're otherwise one of my favorite pairs of sunglasses I've ever worn and look great on me. Eventually I found small screws that fit, so I can just replace the screws now instead of buying new pairs of the glasses entirely.

Also, they're one of the few legitimately polarized sunglasses you can find under $50. However, the molding process for the plastic must not be consistent, because about half the pairs come with the ear pieces bent in wonky directions.

Ultimately they're a weird mix of great value and "you get what you pay for". At least they're cheap, but I do wish they'd improve both issues of the molding consistency and the screws staying in place.

Now, when it came to buying this watch, I was very nervous since no one else reviewed it before me.  I have only had it for a day, but so far it has worked perfectly.  The LEDs are a nice brightness (though they appear MUCH brighter in photos), its a simple mechanism, the only real negative thing I can say is that, in order to see the time, you have to tap the interface, and the interface is pretty sensitive.  If you bump it into someone or something, Id say it will turn on about 79% of the time.  However, though it is sensitive, it can still be worn while sleeping without worry youll tap it and wake yourself up.  Also, when it comes to setting the interface, you really need to time it correctly, cause since there aren't any buttons, it relies on a time delay, so if you time it wrong, the interface will finish reprogramming with you being seconds off.  I cant say anything over how reliable the battery or materials are, as Ive only had it for a day, but for a days use, Id say it was worth the price.

Overall, this costume worked out well.  I bought a different witch hat that made it look better.  However, some fitting notes:

1) I only buy plus size costumes because of my chest size.  The top was very awkward fitting.  It had a very short torso and a very large chest section that was just too much and made me look weird.  I can't imagine it fitting someone who is big in the belly well (sorry, I don't know how else to say it).  I kept pulling the skirt portion as high as I could because my stomach would show any time it would slip down even slightly.
2) The skirt was really really long.  This was good for assisting with the comment in #1, above.  However, even still, it was really really long.  I am 5'6" and I felt like I was going to trip in it.  For reference, I wear size 12-14 in women's pants.
3) The cape that comes with it is a little cheap looking.  I thought the costume looked better without it so I didn't wear it.

The Fab Four's debut album by Ringo Starr, Sentimental Journey on Apple label vinyl is an album of old standards which he recorded for his mom.
These are all backed by the Geoerge Martin Orchestra.
Several names helped arrange the songs, Maurice Gibb, Quincy Jones, Paul McCartney, Klaus Voorman, Elmer Bernstein, and Geoerge Martin himself.
Ringo might just be the first rock star to do an album of standards, of course  the late Harry Nilsson (an old mate of Ringo), and Rod Stewart would be more famous doing these kind of albums.
While not as good as "Ringo" or "Goodnight Vienna", this is a  pretty darn good record.
He would next do an album of all country and western music, called Beaucoups of Blues, also a pretty good album.
Ringo had 4 great albums in a row, 5 including is first greatest hits called, Blast From Yor Past (which sadly had no tracks from this album), the rest of his albums have been pretty much mediocre, with the exception of Time Takes Time and his live LPs with his All Starr Band.

track listing:

side A:

Sentimental Journey
Night And Day
Whispering Grass
Bye Bye Blackbird
I'm A Fool To Care
Star Dust

side b:

Blue, Turning Grey Over You
Love Is A Many Spelendored Thing
Dream
You Always Hurt The One You Love
Have I Told You Lately That I Love You?
Let The Rest of the World Go By
summary: an album of old standards by Richard Starkey, an interesting debut.

I recommend that you order 1 to 2 sized up from your regular # size. I ordered a 34D since that is the equivalent to a 32DD (research bra sizing and comparable sizes for more info). and the cup was too small so if the cup fits you well, then size up on the band size. You also have to keep in mind that when nursing, you are different bra sizes at different times of the day. Be sure your bra fits comfortably and not tight  since it will be very uncomfortable when you are full of milk.

it is strung too tight, in a

the beads are smaller than expected, and

i will be keeping them, because unless you

Okay - let me start by saying I am a clothes snob.  I like well-made, stylish, EXPENSIVE clothing.  But I'm not rich, so...  I read every review of this dress before I ordered it.  Why?  For forty bucks I really was not too worried about what I would do if I didn't like it, but I wanted to be sure it fit in case I DID like it.  And fit seemed to be the biggest topic of the reviews.  After reading, measuring and waffling (more than once), I ordered my regular size (US12).  My measurements were just a little over what the chart listed, but some of the reviews said it was running big, so I took the chance.  It fits perfectly.  It is VERY short-waisted, just 12 inches from the top of the shoulder to where the bodice meets the empire waist.  I'm 5'4, pretty short-waisted myself, and it's ALMOST too short.  This fact is made even more important when you consider that the bodice is VERY skimpy, size-wise.  I am barely a B-cup, and have had a lift, so the girls sit pretty high and tight.  Darned good thing.  Any bigger or lower and they would not have made it into the dress.  That being said, the dress is very nice for the price.  The color (vermillion) is exactly what showed on my monitor.  The fabric is okay quality-wise, nothing to write home about, but the color is gorgeous so I'm betting nobody will notice.  I ordered the matching wrap (really just a scarf) so I would have extra fabric for alterations in case the low cut under the arms bothered me, but it doesn't. so I am going to use the scarf as a sash; it's plenty long enough.  I think I will add some gold trim to the ends of the "sash" just to give the dress some wow factor because it really is very plain.  Classic, but plain.  All-in-all a nice dress, a good value.

I have a drawer full of mack weldon. The sizes are exact, don't order too small, they will be uncomfortable. It seems though they have changed. For the early orders I made a couple years ago the quality was amazing, the comfort was awesome. Everything fit perfect. The silver line was amazing. I bought their loungewear, long underwear, just about every piece of clothing they make. But I have noticed over the past year that the quality seems to be going down. The last pair of long underwear a purchased had the fly stitched very unusually, you could not even make use of it. That was very disappointing because that is one thing I had loved about their underwear was how usable the fly was compared to other brands. I bought a second pair of long underwear thinking I got a bad pair, but it was the same. Then last time I ordered silver, it seemed like material had changed, it was not as soft and maybe it is my imagination, but it does not seem to have the same cooling effect I got from my earlier silver purchases. My one greatest long term disappointment is I thought with the price point their products might hold up longer than their cheaper (Hanes, etc) competitors, but in the end they wear out about the same right. After about a year, they stop feeling so soft, by two years its about time to replace them. (I have wore almost nothing but Mack Weldon for three years now)

So I have downgraded from five star to four because of what seems to be their lowering quality. If they were so expensive I would go easier on them. But with what these things cost, they should be perfect. For what you pay for one pair from them, you could get ten pairs from Hanes. So its fair to expect 10 times the quality, comfort, etc.
summary: For the early orders I made a couple years ago the quality was amazing, the comfort was awesome

reviewText: Fit great, felt great all day. 3 Star review (and the reason I won't buy anymore) is  because they print the name, size and other information on the outside on the butt! Rather than on the inside where others cant see it at the gym etc. Very weird and a complete turnoff

reviewText: I have purchased briefs, boxer briefs, and T-shirts from MW.  Nothing has been satisfactory.  The briefs and boxers are "designed" so it is difficult to urinate, the T-shirts shrank.  What a waste of money!!!~!

Last year I would have said Mack Weldon was the best underwear.  However after my latest purchase the quality and workmanship has deteriorated.  I even contacted the company and all I got was a "we'll let production know".  Well guess what at the price of these shorts, there is no way I would gamble with this company and not even get a refund.

The material has been changed and the cut has been changed.  This was not a one off defect product was a multiple piece order.  No thanks Mack, there's other brands that haven't sold out their QC department to make more money.
summary: They changed the material and cut

reviewText:
I bought three pairs (different styles) of the Mack Weldon underwear  I tried the AirKnit first.  They weren't any more comfortable that Jockey brand.  I went for my constitutional (4 mile walk) and the small amount of perspiration caused the color to leach out of the brief onto my T-shirt.  I rinsed them off in the sink, and the charcoal color poured out.  My wife operates a gonzo laundry, everything goes in together (light, dark, delicate, etc.)  It would have been a disaster had these gone into our laundry.

How can they claim this is a premium product when they can't get the basics (colorfast) right?

Im giving these a two star over the price. There really CAN be a difference between lower and higher priced fabrics when it comes to fit and feel. These are simply decent underwear. They do have a uniquely snug feel and its not like I hate them. But, do I LOVE them and want to oay $28 dollars a pair? Absolutely not. Hey are a $14 pair of underwear and thats being generous.
summary: They do have a uniquely snug feel and its not like I hate them
